result.execSummary:
The defendant Michcal W. Leslie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
Contact with KKS to be determined by the agent and to follow all applicable rules and orders.  
Defendant is to comply with all applicable child protective orders or other applicable orders through social services or other Courts.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to commence his sentence on or before 09/16/2016 no later than 7:00 pm  Huber granted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michcal W. Leslie
